rules.natural: If the venue manager is authorized for the main stage, then the main performance show proceeds.
If the promoter has paid the deposit, then whenever a refund is issued to ticket holders, the headliner performance show is cancelled.
In the event of a power outage due to grid failure, the backup generator is active at the venue.

Either there is a power outage due to grid failure, or there is a weather alert for a severe storm, or if the staff have completed the safety drill, then the emergency exit is clear in the east wing or the main performance show proceeds.
Given that the venue manager is authorized for backstage, the main performance show proceeds.
If the production has a technical crew for lighting, the lighting rig equipment is ready on the main stage.
The production has a technical crew for either lighting or sound.
Provided that the production has a technical crew for sound, the venue manager is authorized for backstage.
Both the lighting rig equipment is ready on the main stage and the speaker system equipment is ready on the main stage.
If the speaker system equipment is ready on the main stage, then the venue manager is authorized for the main stage.
Whenever the venue has passed the fire inspection, then the emergency exit is clear in the east wing or the main performance show proceeds.
Either the venue has passed the fire inspection or the staff have completed the safety drill.
In the event that it is not the case that if the headliner band has signed the contract then the promoter has paid the deposit, the venue owner has filed a lawsuit.
Should it not hold that if the staff have completed the safety drill then the emergency exit is clear in the east wing or the main performance show proceeds, a refund is issued to ticket holders.

facts.natural: The headliner band has signed the contract.
It is not the case that the headliner performance show is cancelled.
The venue owner has not filed a lawsuit.
There is no weather alert for a severe storm.
The backup generator is not active at the venue.
The emergency exit is not clear in the east wing.

(A1 → G).natural: If the venue manager is authorized for the main stage, then the main performance show proceeds.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: The venue manager is authorized for either the main stage or backstage.

(A12 → (A11 → A10)).natural: Whenever the headliner band has signed the contract, then if a refund is issued to ticket holders, the headliner performance show is cancelled.

(A13 → (A11 → A10)).natural: If the promoter has paid the deposit, then whenever a refund is issued to ticket holders, the headliner performance show is cancelled.

(A15 ∨ (A9 → (A7 ∨ G))).natural: Either there is a weather alert for a severe storm, or if the staff have completed the safety drill, then the emergency exit is clear in the east wing or the main performance show proceeds.

(A16 → A17).natural: In the event of a power outage due to grid failure, the backup generator is active at the venue.
